name: Ibis Dresden Konigstein

reviews.text: "Our A/C is broken," I said to the front desk, "Can we get another room?" "No, they're all like that," the woman replied. She sheepishly showed us two more rooms, and she was correct.
reviews.title: Rooms *NOT* air-conditioned!

reviews.text: The so-called climate control promised by Ibis' Web site turned out to just be a fan in each room, not a proper A/C with a compressor that cools the air. Judging by all the open windows across the street at Hotel Lillienstien, they didn't seem to have A/C either.
reviews.title: Review of the hotel

likes.disliked: — Restaurant only opened in the evenings

reviews.title: Good location
reviews.text: This kind of false advertising just shouldn't happen. The Ibis hotel chain promises a refund if they can't "fix your problem." We'll see whether that's real, or just more empty promises from Ibis.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: We booked a double room and a three-bed room. The third bed of this room it is not a bed, but a big sofa. Rooms on the avarage (ok and exactly the same as any other Ibis hotel). We had some problems during the check in with the prices of the rooms we had booked that were finally solved out. The location is excellent for sightseeing. We wanted to have lunch at the hotel but this was not possible as the restaurant was only opened in the evenings.

I was extremely pleased with this Ibis hotel in Dresden. My room was exceptionally clean and roomy. The room was decorated in Scandinavian or IKEA style furnishings. Plenty of hot water, good water pressure and towels were changed daily. My bed was nice and firm.
reviews.title: Should be more than 2.5 stars!

reviews.text: Booked the hotel on Expedia and the hotel was right on top with the reservation. E-mails to the hotel to check on my Expedia reservation were answered in a very timely manner. Breakfast was included in the price and included meats, cheeses, yogurt and plenty of fresh fruit. If you don't have breakfast with the room rate, there are plenty of nice cafes and bakeries in the vicinity to purchase breakfast. There is a Starbucks just a short distance from the hotel. There is also a grocery store in the lower level of the shopping mall where Starbucks is located.
reviews.title: Good location, 5 mins to Central Train Station

reviews.text: This hotel is just a short walk from the main train station. You can take the train from the airport for only 1.90 Euro - one of the best bargains in Germany. You can purchase the ticket on the train platform. Just remember to validate it with a nearby machine before you board the train. There are train conductors on board to make sure you have a valid ticket. Once you exit the train station, look for Prager Strasse and keep walking along the pedestrian street. On your left your will see 3 Ibis hotels - the Koenigstein is the one in the middle.
reviews.title: Cheap and profitable

reviews.text: I found the front desk staff extremely helpful, though reserved. You can borrow a hair dryer from the front desk for your stay - just your room number - no charge. English TV channels were Euronews, Bloomberg and BBC World.
reviews.title: It does what it says on the tin!

reviews.text: Rooms are really small (the smallest room and bed throughout our Europe trip) but it was clean and located really close to Central Station and shopping malls.
reviews.title: Nothing more than 'OK'

likes.liked: — Close to train station (but not the closest hotel to it...)

description: The Ibis Dresden Königstein is located in the Prager Strasse pedestrian area, only 250 m from the central railway station and 800 m from the historic centre of Dresden. The Neue Messe exhibition centre and convention centre are 5 km away. 306 airconditioned rooms are available for booking. The hotel also has a restaurant, a bar serving snacks 24 hours and a meeting room. WiFi wireless Internet access for guests on a business trip. Public pay parking close to the hotel.
